</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Currency: </strong></span><span><span>Everyone is talking about how the surging dollar could dent growth. Well, at the very least </span></span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1227271072535498754?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">President Trump</a></span><span><span>, the </span></span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/9aef3036-4c40-11ea-95a0-43d18ec715f5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FT</a></span><span><span>, and the </span></span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/dollars-surprise-surge-challenges-stock-market-rally-11581256801?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a></span><span><span> are. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CONSUMER TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/unpacking-samsungs-unpacked-event-san-francisco?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Samsung Flips Off Apple
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Samsung's new phones" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNDYzNDI4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Samsung</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After years of watching fashion retailers deny women's requests for bigger pockets, Samsung finally did something about it. At yesterday’s Galaxy Unpacked event in San Francisco, the smartphone manufacturer <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/samsung-unveils-new-lineup-of-smartphones-11581447601?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=1&mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> the Galaxy Z Flip, a smartphone that folds into a pocket-size square.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It also showed off a line of new earbuds and phones loaded with 5G compatibility and high-tech cameras. But back to the important stuff. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Second time’s the charm? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, after two delays and a failed launch, Samsung shipped the first Galaxy Fold, a small tablet-sized device that hotdog-folds into a normal-sized smartphone. The phone underwhelmed with half a million orders. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Samsung went back to the drawing board and came up with the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/11/21126318/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-foldable-phone-release-date-price-features?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1,380 Z Flip</a>. The folding display is good for 200,000 angsty slams shut and can split into two separate screens. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What Samsung doesn’t feel good about</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A slowing global economy, crowded smartphone market, South Korea’s trade dispute with Japan, and competition from Chinese brands, all of which hurt 2019 profits. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the biggest smartphone maker in the world, Samsung is playing defense while trying to out-innovate competitors with premium handsets and 5G. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It had </span><span><a href="https://www.counterpointresearch.com/global-smartphone-share/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">21% of the global smartphone market</a></span><span> as of Q3 last year, according to Counterpoint research, but Huawei (18%) is creeping up and Apple (12%) is marshaling its Animoji army.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apple isn’t expected to release a 5G phone until later this year, while Huawei released eight last year. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last month, Samsung </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-samsung-elec-smartphone/samsung-appoints-new-mobile-chief-as-huawei-chips-away-at-market-share-idUSKBN1ZJ01X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">named</a></span><span> a new smartphone chief and promoted the head of its network equipment business. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Huawei is also challenging Samsung in the semiconductor market. Chips accounted for about 75% of Samsung’s profit as of 2018, but in Q4 2019 slowing chip sales knocked <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/samsung-posts-lower-profit-anticipates-end-of-chip-slump-11580347060?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">net profit</a> almost 40%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Samsung hopes 5G phones and other new devices will help it maintain its lead in 2020.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELECOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/federal-judge-gives-blessing-tmobile-sprint-merger?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Wingman Like a Federal Judge
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="T-Mobile and Sprint phones connected to each other " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1ODIzODY4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, U.S. District Judge Victor Marrero ordered T-Mobile and Sprint another Shiraz and left them alone with the room key. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marrero <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/t-mobile-sprint-judge-didn-134234897.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tossed out</a> a lawsuit against the wireless carriers’ proposed merger. The suit was brought by a group of state attorneys general who argued the tie-up would reduce competition and jack up your cellphone bill. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>To appease competition concerns, Dish Network </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/judge-approves-merger-of-t-mobile-and-sprint-11581427244?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will now enter</a></span><span> the wireless market.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Consider New York AG Letitia James, who co-led the suit, among those not appeased. She said she’s considering an appeal. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Currently, T-Mobile and Sprint are the country’s third- and fourth-largest wireless carriers behind Verizon and AT&T. But the industry is evolving, and T-Mobile said it needed Sprint’s spectrum licenses to help fuel its push to 5G. The combined entity will have about 100 million customers—more than AT&T—and be called T-Mobile. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the deal still needs sign-offs from another federal judge and California’s utility board. But the companies expect the transaction to close as soon as April 1.</p>

<tr>

</a>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/sirius-invests-75-million-revived-soundcloud?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sirius Supports Streaming Sister, SoundCloud
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Dog riding on a cloud in the shape of a SoundCloud logo " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNDU5NjIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, satellite radio company Sirius XM said it <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/02/11/music-streaming-pioneer-soundcloud-raises-75m-from-pandora-owner-siriusxm/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will inject</a> $75 million into SoundCloud.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In return, it’ll get a minority stake (we don’t know the exact percentage) plus two new board seats. SoundCloud said it will use the cash to finesse its services and product development. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How we got here:</strong> SoundCloud launched in 2008 as an open platform for artists to promote their work. But about 10 years later, challenges around the main pillars of the audio streaming biz (monetization and licensing) pushed SoundCloud to the <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/ryanmac/inside-the-storm-at-soundcloud?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brink of collapse</a>. Investment firms Raine Group and Temasek swooped in with $170 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now, SoundCloud is in a much better place. </strong>In addition to supporting unsigned artists, it licenses music from labels. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>SoundCloud did $127 million in sales in 2018, and this year it says it’s on track to top $200 million. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">These two have met before: </strong>In 2019, Sirius unit Pandora struck a deal with SoundCloud to create a digital audio advertising marketplace that reaches over 100 million U.S. listeners.</p>

</a>
</td>
</tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/uk-gdp-not-budge-fourth-quarter-2019?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The U.K. Is Turning the Page on 2019
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Concept image of the Euston station redevelopment" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTU3L2NvbmNlcHRfaW1hZ2Vfb2ZfdGhlX2V1c3Rvbl9zdGF0aW9uX3JlZGV2ZWxvcG1lbnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>HS2 | A rendering of the Euston station redevelopment in London</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.K. GDP growth <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2020/feb/11/uk-gdp-british-economy-zero-growth?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stood still</a> in Q4 2019, the region’s last full quarter in the EU.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In addition to </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/britain-officially-leaves-eu?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brexit</a></span><span> uncertainty, slower trade and a wilting eurozone dragged down growth. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But as much as we mercilessly teased the U.K. in 2019, its full-year economic growth of 1.4% outpaced that of France </span><span><em>and</em></span><span> Germany. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>January data shows the U.K. <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2020/jan/24/pressure-eases-on-bank-to-cut-interest-rates-as-uk-economy-improves-bank-of-england?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doing better than expected</a>. Keep an eye on trade talks with the U.S. and Parliament’s attempts to juice the economy. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Juice secured </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">PM Boris Johnson <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/e35febca-4cc8-11ea-95a0-43d18ec715f5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">greenlit HS2</a> yesterday, a controversial $140 billion high-speed rail line. It was delayed while Johnson reviewed the ballooning price tag and environmental concerns. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The plan:</strong></span><span> 345 miles of tracks connecting London to northern England. Once operational, it’ll carry ~300,000 passengers daily and reduce the trip to Hogwarts by 20%. HS2 will be Europe’s largest infrastructure project. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It also lets Johnson reward Midland and northern Tories for their electoral support in December, when he promised to shift the U.K.’s economic gravity away from London.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>The proposed route, via <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-51461597?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the BBC</a>. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/news/624/cpsprodpb/10C76/production/_110862786_hs2_route_map_640-v2-nc.png" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="HS2 route"></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F11%2Fuk-gdp-not-budge-fourth-quarter-2019" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PERSONAL FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/us-household-debt-tops-14-trillion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stat That Makes You Go Wow
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Dr. Phil is beside himself" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=392 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0IypeKl9NJhPFMrK/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Dr. Phil is beside himself" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0IypeKl9NJhPFMrK/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. household debt hit a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-11/u-s-household-debt-exceeds-14-trillion-for-the-first-time?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new record</a> last quarter—$14.2 trillion. That’s an increase of $193 billion from Q3 and marks the 22nd straight quarter Americans have increased their borrowing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Quick hits from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York’s report: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Mortgage balances: </strong></span><span>up $120 billion to $9.6 trillion</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Student loan balances: </strong></span><span><span>up $10 billion to $1.5 trillion</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Credit card debt: </strong></span><span><span>up more than usual ($46 billion) in the busy holiday shopping period</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"></strong><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The economy may be strong, but <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-fed-household-debt/u-s-household-debt-tops-14-trillion-and-reaches-new-record-idUSKBN20521Z?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">student loans in particular</a> are leading to higher delinquency rates among younger Americans.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So far during Merger Week we’ve covered 1) <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/not-cuz-like-companies-merge?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">why companies merge</a> and 2) <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/swipe-right-merge-companies-find-love?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">how they start dating</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now, things are getting serious.</strong> You’re sharing an office. You’ve met all the shareholders’ inlaws. You’ve proposed and set a date for the signing.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the hardest part is still to come: planning for the event. Today, the Brew’s Kinsey Grant explores what happens in a deal before the ink dries, from the investment bankers to the NDAs. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/planning-merger-planning-unexpected?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it here</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everyone has their own dream merger.</strong> In 2017, RBC Capital Markets floated the idea of Apple acquiring Disney. Here are ours:</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter years of watching fashion retailers deny women's requests for bigger pockets, Samsung finally did something about it. At yesterday’s Galaxy Unpacked event in San Francisco, the smartphone manufacturer \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/samsung-unveils-new-lineup-of-smartphones-11581447601?mod=searchresults\u0026page=1\u0026pos=1\u0026mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunveiled\u003c/a\u003e the Galaxy Z Flip, a smartphone that folds into a pocket-size square.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt also showed off a line of new earbuds and phones loaded with 5G compatibility and high-tech cameras. But back to the important stuff. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSecond time’s the charm? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year, after two delays and a failed launch, Samsung shipped the first Galaxy Fold, a small tablet-sized device that hotdog-folds into a normal-sized smartphone. The phone underwhelmed with half a million orders. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSamsung went back to the drawing board and came up with the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/11/21126318/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-foldable-phone-release-date-price-features?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1,380 Z Flip\u003c/a\u003e. The folding display is good for 200,000 angsty slams shut and can split into two separate screens. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat Samsung doesn’t feel good about\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA slowing global economy, crowded smartphone market, South Korea’s trade dispute with Japan, and competition from Chinese brands, all of which hurt 2019 profits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the biggest smartphone maker in the world, Samsung is playing defense while trying to out-innovate competitors with premium handsets and 5G. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt had \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.counterpointresearch.com/global-smartphone-share/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e21% of the global smartphone market\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e as of Q3 last year, according to Counterpoint research, but Huawei (18%) is creeping up and Apple (12%) is marshaling its Animoji army.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApple isn’t expected to release a 5G phone until later this year, while Huawei released eight last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast month, Samsung \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-samsung-elec-smartphone/samsung-appoints-new-mobile-chief-as-huawei-chips-away-at-market-share-idUSKBN1ZJ01X?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enamed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a new smartphone chief and promoted the head of its network equipment business. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHuawei is also challenging Samsung in the semiconductor market. Chips accounted for about 75% of Samsung’s profit as of 2018, but in Q4 2019 slowing chip sales knocked \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/samsung-posts-lower-profit-anticipates-end-of-chip-slump-11580347060?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enet profit\u003c/a\u003e almost 40%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSamsung hopes 5G phones and other new devices will help it collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, U.S. District Judge Victor Marrero ordered T-Mobile and Sprint another Shiraz and left them alone with the room key. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMarrero \u003ca #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etossed out\u003c/a\u003e a lawsuit against the wireless carriers’ proposed merger. The suit was brought by a group of state attorneys general who argued the tie-up would reduce competition and jack up your cellphone bill. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTo appease competition concerns, Dish Network \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/judge-approves-merger-of-t-mobile-and-sprint-11581427244?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill now enter\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the wireless market.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eConsider New York AG Letitia James, who co-led the suit, among those not appeased. She said she’s considering an appeal. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eCurrently, T-Mobile and Sprint are the country’s third- and fourth-largest wireless carriers behind Verizon and AT\u0026T. But the industry is evolving, and T-Mobile said it needed Sprint’s spectrum licenses to help fuel its push to 5G. The combined entity will have about 100 million customers—more than AT\u0026T—and be called T-Mobile. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe deal still needs sign-offs from another federal judge and California’s utility board. But the companies expect the transaction to close as soon as April 1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, satellite radio company Sirius XM said it \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/02/11/music-streaming-pioneer-soundcloud-raises-75m-from-pandora-owner-siriusxm/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill inject\u003c/a\u003e $75 million into SoundCloud.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn return, it’ll get a minority stake (we don’t know the exact percentage) plus two new board seats. SoundCloud said it will use the cash to finesse its services and product development. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow we got here:\u003c/strong\u003e SoundCloud launched in 2008 as an open platform for artists to promote their work. But about 10 years later, challenges around the main pillars of the audio streaming biz (monetization and licensing) pushed SoundCloud to the \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/ryanmac/inside-the-storm-at-soundcloud?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebrink of collapse\u003c/a\u003e. Investment firms Raine Group and Temasek swooped in with $170 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNow, SoundCloud is in a much better place. \u003c/strong\u003eIn addition to supporting unsigned artists, it licenses music from labels. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSoundCloud did $127 million in sales in 2018, and this year it says it’s on track to top $200 million. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThese two have met before: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2019, Sirius unit Pandora struck a deal with SoundCloud to create a digital audio advertising marketplace that reaches over collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.K. GDP growth \u003ca #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estood still\u003c/a\u003e in Q4 2019, the region’s last full quarter in the EU.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn addition to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/britain-officially-leaves-eu?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBrexit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e uncertainty, slower trade and a wilting eurozone dragged down growth. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut as much as we mercilessly teased the U.K. in 2019, its full-year economic growth of 1.4% outpaced that of France \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Germany. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eJanuary data shows the U.K. \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2020/jan/24/pressure-eases-on-bank-to-cut-interest-rates-as-uk-economy-improves-bank-of-england?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoing better than expected\u003c/a\u003e. Keep an eye on trade talks with the U.S. and Parliament’s attempts to juice the economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eJuice secured \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePM Boris Johnson \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/e35febca-4cc8-11ea-95a0-43d18ec715f5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egreenlit HS2\u003c/a\u003e yesterday, a controversial $140 billion high-speed rail line. It was delayed while Johnson reviewed the ballooning price tag and environmental concerns. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe plan:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 345 miles of tracks connecting London to northern England. Once operational, it’ll carry ~300,000 passengers daily and reduce the trip to Hogwarts by 20%. HS2 will be Europe’s largest infrastructure project. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt also lets Johnson reward Midland and northern Tories for their electoral support in December, when he promised to shift the U.K.’s economic gravity away from London.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
